mocharts.Figure#

class mocharts.Figure(chart_id: str = None, link_id: str = None, title: Title = None, grid: Grid = None, legend: Legend = None, yAxis: list = None, xAxis: list = None, parallelAxis: list = None, series: list = None, visualmap: PiecewiseVisualMap | ContinuousVisualMap = None, toolbox: Toolbox = None, tooltip: Tooltip = None, brush: Brush = None, dataZoom: list = None, event: Event = None, graphic: list = None, radar: dict = None, animation: Animation = None, figsize: tuple = (8, 6), color: list = ['#1f77b4', '#ff7f0e', '#2ca02c', '#e377c2', '#9467bd', '#d62728', '#8c564b', '#bcbd22', '#17becf', '#7f7f7f'], silent: bool = False, meta_info: dict = {}, auto_size: bool = True, style: dict = {'overflow': 'auto'})#

Bases: object

Figure object

Parameters:

  • chart_id (str, default=None) – Chart ID.

  • link_id (str, default=None) – ID to link other chart.

  • title (Title, default=None) – Title of chart.

  • grid (Grid, default=None) – Grid of chart.

  • legend (Legend, default=None) – Legend of chart.

  • yAxis (list, default=None) – List of yaxis.

  • xAxis (list, default=None) – List of xaxis.

  • parallelAxis (list, default=None) – ParallelAxis of chart, only works for parallel plot.

  • series (list, default=None) – List of series.

  • visualmap (Union[PiecewiseVisualMap, ContinuousVisualMap], default=None) – Visualmap of chart.

  • toolbox (Toolbox, default=None) – Toolbox of chart.

  • tooltip (Tooltip, default=None) – Tooltip of chart.

  • brush (Brush, default=None) – Brush of chart.

  • dataZoom (list, default=None) – List of Datazoom object.

  • event (Event, default=None) – Event of chart.

  • graphic (list, default=None) – List of graphic info.

  • radar (dict, default=None) – Dict of radar info.

  • animation (Animation, default=None) – Animation of chart.

  • figsize (tuple, default=(8, 6)) – Figure size of chart.

  • color (list, default=DEFAULT_QUALITATIVE_PALETTE) – Color palette of chart.

  • silent (bool, default=False) – Whether to show the figure.

  • meta_info (dict, default={}) – Meta info.

  • auto_size (bool, default=True) – Whether to adjust the figure element size automatically.

  • style (dict, default={'overflow': 'auto'}) – Style css of the figure.

add(plot, serie_name: str = None, xaxis_idx: int = 0, yaxis_idx: int = 0)#

Add plot to this figure object. If xaxis_idx or yaxis_idx is beyond the range of existing axes, their values will be set to the length of the existing axes plus 1.

Parameters:

  • plot (Figure) – The Figure object to add.

  • serie_name (str, default=None) – The series name to add.

  • xaxis_idx (int, default=0) – The index of the x-axis this plot is going to share.

  • yaxis_idx (int, default=0) – The index of the y-axis this plot is going to share.

add_annotation(text_list: list = [], left_list: list = [], top_list: list = [], right_list: list = [], bottom_list: list = [], silent: bool = True, fontsize: int = 12)#

Add annotations on the figure

Parameters:

  • text_list (list, default=[]) – The texts to display.

  • left_list (list, default=[]) – Left distance for each text.

  • top_list (list, default=[]) – Top distance for each text.

  • right_list (list, default=[]) – Right distance for each text.

  • bottom_list (list, default=[]) – Bottom distance for each text.

  • silent (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the annotation.

  • fontsize (int, default=12) – Font size.

add_hline(y: float | int, series_ind: int = None, color: str = None, line_type: str = None, show_label: bool = False, silent: bool = True)#

Add one horizontal line to plot

Parameters:

  • y (float, int) – The y value of this line.

  • series_ind (int, default=None) – The index of this line among series.

  • color (str, default=None) – The color of this line.

  • line_type (str, default=None) – The type of line.

  • show_label (bool, default=False) – Whether to show the label on the line.

  • silent (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the line.

add_vline(x: float | int, series_ind: int = None, color: str = None, line_type: str = None, show_label: bool = False, silent: bool = True)#

Add one vertical line to plot

Parameters:

  • x (float, int) – The x value of this line.

  • series_ind (int, default=None) – The index of this line among series.

  • color (str, default=None) – The color of this line.

  • line_type (str, default=None) – The type of line.

  • show_label (bool, default=False) – Whether to show the label on the line.

  • silent (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the line.

render()#

Get dictionary of options for this figure

save(options: dict = None, file_name: str = 'mocharts', format: str = 'png')#

Save the plot to png or html

Parameters:

  • options (dict, default=None) – The plot options to save. If None, options will be got from self.render().

  • file_name (str, default='mocharts') – The file name to save.

  • format (str, default='png') – The format to save.

set_animation(allow_animation: bool = True)#

Set animation

Parameters:

allow_animation (bool, default=True) – Whether to allow animation.

set_brush(toolbox: list = None, brush_type: str = None, brush_mode: str = None, brush_style: dict = None, remove_on_click: bool = None, in_brush: dict = None, out_of_brush: dict = None)#

Brush settings

Parameters:

  • toolbox (list, default=None) – Use the buttons in the toolbox, If None, toolbox will be [‘rect’, ‘polygon’, ‘keep’, ‘clear’].

  • brush_type (str, default=None) –

    Type of brush. Options:

    • ’rect’: for selection-box in rectangle shape.

    • ’polygon’: for selection-box in polygon shape.

    • ’lineX’: for horizontal selection-box.

    • ’lineY’: for vertical selection-box.

  • brush_mode (str, default=None) – Brush mode, can be ‘single’ or ‘multiple’.

  • brush_style (dict, default=None) – Brush style.

  • remove_on_click (bool, default=None) – Whether clearing all select-boxes on click is enabled when brushMode is ‘single’.

  • in_brush (dict, default=None) – Defines visual effects of items in selection.

  • out_of_brush (dict, default=None) – Defines visual effects of items out of selection.

set_datazoom(show: bool = True, horizontal_inside: bool = True, vertical_inside: bool = False, horizontal_slider: bool = True, vertical_slider: bool = False)#

Set datazoom config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the slider.

  • horizontal_inside (bool, default=True) – Whether to allow horizontal inside zoom.

  • vertical_inside (bool, default=False) – Whether to allow vertical inside zoom.

  • horizontal_slider (bool, default=True) – Whether to allow horizontal slider zoom.

  • vertical_slider (bool, default=False) – Whether to allow vertical slider zoom.

set_event(event_id: str = None, link_id: str = None, type_: str = None, task: str = 'singleselect', plot_type: str = None, func=None, additional_info: dict = None)#

Set chart event

Parameters:

  • event_id (str, default=None) – The ID of the event to store event information. If None, the timestamp is used as the event_id.

  • link_id (str, default=None) – The div ID for output result.

  • type (str, default=None) – The event type to trigger, including “click”, “brushselected”, etc.

  • task (str, default='singleselect') – The event task to perform, including “singleselect”, “doubleselect”, etc.

  • plot_type (str, default=None) – The plot type to trigger the event, including “bar”, “scatter”, etc.

  • func (Callable, default=None) – The function that will be triggered.

  • additional_info (dict, default=None) – A dictionary to store additional information.

set_figsize(figsize: tuple)#

Set figsize

Parameters:

figsize (tuple) – The figure size

set_grid(show: bool = True, left: str = None, top: str = '10%', right: str = '10%', bottom: str = None, width: str = 'auto', height: str = 'auto', contain_label: bool = True, background_color: str = None)#

Set grid config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the grid.

  • left (str, default=None) – The left border location.

  • top (str, default='10%') – The top border location.

  • right (str, default='10%') – The right border location.

  • bottom (str, default=None) – The bottom border location.

  • width (str, default='auto') – The grid width.

  • height (str, default='auto') – The grid height.

  • contain_label (bool, default=True) – Whether the grid region contains axis labels.

  • background_color (str, default=None) – The grid background color.

set_legend(show: bool = True, data: list | ndarray = None, loc: str = 'outer top right', left: str = None, right: str = None, top: str = None, bottom: str = None, width: str = 'auto', height: str = 'auto', orient: str = 'vertical', unselected: list = [], legend_type: str = 'plain', text_width: int = None, tooltip_title: str = None, title: str = None)#

Set legend config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the legend.

  • data (Union[list, numpy.ndarray], default=None) – The legend content. If None, all data is extracted from series.

  • loc (str, default='outer top right') –

    The legend location. Options:

    ’outer top left’, ‘outer top right’, ‘outer bottom left’, ‘outer bottom right’, ‘outer top center’, ‘outer bottom center’, ‘outer center left’, ‘outer left’, ‘outer center right’, ‘outer right’, ‘top left’, ‘top right’, ‘bottom left’, ‘bottom right’, ‘top center’, ‘bottom center’, ‘center left’, ‘left’, ‘center right’, ‘right’, ‘center’.

  • left (str, default=None) – Distance between legend component and the left side of the container.

  • right (str, default=None) – Distance between legend component and the right side of the container.

  • top (str, default=None) – Distance between legend component and the top side of the container.

  • bottom (str, default=None) – Distance between legend component and the bottom side of the container.

  • width (str, default='auto') – The legend frame width.

  • height (str, default='auto') – The legend frame height.

  • orient (str, default='vertical') – The legend arrangement.

  • unselected (list, default=[]) – The initial unselected series names.

  • legend_type (str, default='plain') – Type of legend. Options: [‘plain’, ‘scroll’].

  • text_width (int, default=None) – The text width.

  • tooltip_title (str, default=None) – The legend title shown in the tooltip.

  • title (str, default=None) – The legend title shown above the legend.

set_radar(names: list | ndarray)#

Set radar infomation

Parameters:

names (Union[list, numpy.ndarray]) – Names of each axis.

set_title(text: str = None, show: bool = True, left: str = '50%', right: str = 'auto', top: str = 'auto', bottom: str = 'auto', fontsize: int = 15, color: str = None, text_align: str = 'auto')#

Set title config

Parameters:

  • text (str, default=None) – Text content of the title.

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the title.

  • left (str, default='50%') – Distance between title component and the left side of the container.

  • right (str, default='auto') – Distance between title component and the right side of the container.

  • top (str, default='auto') – Distance between title component and the top side of the container.

  • bottom (str, default='auto') – Distance between title component and the bottom side of the container.

  • fontsize (str, default=DEFAULT_TITLE_SIZE) – Font size of the title.

  • color (str, default=None) – Font color of the title.

  • text_align (str, default='auto') – How to align the title.

set_toolbox(show: bool = True, orient: str = 'horizontal', left: str = 'auto', right: str = '1%', bottom: str = 'auto', top: str = 'auto', tool_list: list = ['dataZoom', 'saveAsImage'], item_size: float = 15, item_gap: float = 8, popup: bool = True)#

Set toolbox config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the toolbox.

  • orient (str, default='horizontal') – The layout orientation of the toolbox’s icon.

  • left (str, default='auto') – Distance between the toolbox component and the left side of the container.

  • right (str, default='1%') – Distance between the toolbox component and the right side of the container.

  • bottom (str, default='auto') – Distance between the toolbox component and the bottom side of the container.

  • top (str, default='auto') – Distance between the toolbox component and the top side of the container.

  • tool_list (list, default=['dataZoom', 'saveAsImage']) –

    The tools included in the toolbox. Options:

    • ’saveAsImage’: Save as image.

    • ’restore’: Restore configuration item.

    • ’dataView’: Data view tool, which displays data in the current chart and updates the chart after editing.

    • ’dataZoom’: Data area zooming, which only supports rectangular coordinate systems.

    • ’magicType’: Change plot type.

  • item_size (float, default=15.) – The size of each item in the toolbox.

  • item_gap (float, default=8.) – The gap between each two items.

  • popup (bool, default=True) – Whether to include a popup function in the toolbox.

set_tooltip(show: bool = True, trigger: str = None, trigger_on: str = None, type: str = None, formatter: str = None, precision: int = None, custom_tooltip: bool = None, extra_css_text: str = None)#

Set tooltip config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the tooltip.

  • trigger (str, default=None) –

    Type of triggering. Options:

    • ’item’: Triggered by data item, typically used for charts that don’t have a category axis.

    • ’axis’: Triggered by axes, typically used for charts that have category axes.

    • ’none’: Trigger nothing.

    If None, it will be ‘item’

  • trigger_on (str, default=None) –

    Conditions to trigger the tooltip. Options:

    • ’mousemove’: Trigger when the mouse moves.

    • ’click’: Trigger when the mouse clicks.

    • ’mousemove|click’: Trigger when the mouse moves or clicks.

    • ’none’: No triggers.

    If None, it will be ‘mousemove|click’.

  • type (str, default=None) –

    Indicator type. Options:

    • ’line’: Line indicator.

    • ’shadow’: Shadow crosshair indicator.

    • ’none’: No indicator displayed.

    • ’cross’: Crosshair indicator, which enables two-axis pointers.

    If None, it will be ‘shadow’.

  • formatter (str, default=None) – The content formatter for the tooltip’s floating layer, which supports string templates and callback functions. The template variables are {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, and {e}, corresponding to series name, data name, data value, and more.

  • precision (int, default=None) – The precision of the tooltip value.

  • custom_tooltip (bool, default=None) – Whether to use a custom tooltip.

  • extra_css_text (str, default=None) – The CSS for the tooltip.

set_visualmap(type: str = 'continuous', color: list = ['#440154', '#481467', '#482576', '#453781', '#404688', '#39558c', '#33638d', '#2d718e', '#287d8e', '#238a8d', '#1f968b', '#20a386', '#29af7f', '#3dbc74', '#56c667', '#75d054', '#95d840', '#bade28', '#dde318', '#fde725'], map_min: float | int = None, map_max: float | int = None, map_range: list = None, split_number: int = 5, calculable: bool = False, orient: str = 'vertical', left: str = 'auto', bottom: str = 'auto', right: str = 'auto', top: str = 'auto', height: float = 140, width: float = 20, title: str = None, dimension: int = None, precision: int = None)#

Set color visual map

Parameters:

  • type (str, default='continuous') – The type of visual map, can be ‘continuous’ or ‘piecewise’.

  • color (list, default=DEFAULT_SEQUENCIAL_PALETTE) – Color palette for visual map.

  • map_min (Union[int, float], default=None) – Minimum value of the visual map.

  • map_max (Union[int, float], default=None) – Maximum value of the visual map.

  • map_range (list, default=None) – Selected range.

  • split_number (int, default=5) – The number of split ranges, only works when type=’piecewise’.

  • calculable (bool, default=False) – Whether to support dragging.

  • orient (str, default='vertical') – The visual map display orientation.

  • left (str, default='auto') – Distance between visual map component and the left side of the container.

  • bottom (str, default='auto') – Distance between visual map component and the bottom side of the container.

  • right (str, default='auto') – Distance between visual map component and the right side of the container.

  • top (str, default='auto') – Distance between visual map component and the top side of the container.

  • height (float, default=140.) – The height of the visual map bar.

  • width (float, default=20.) – The width of the visual map bar.

  • title (str, default=None) – Title text above the visual map.

  • dimension (int, default=None) – Specify which dimension should be used to fetch data values from series.data, and then map them to the visual channel.

  • precision (int, default=None) – The decimal precision of the label.

set_xaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = None, lim: list | tuple = None, boundary_gap: bool = None, name_gap: str | int = None, name_location: str = None, axis_label_interval: int = None, axis_label_width: int = None, axis_label_overflow: str = 'none', axis_label_rotate: int = None, split_number: int = None, split_area_show: bool = False, split_line_show: bool = True, axis_tick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set x-axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the axis.

  • axis_type (str, default=None) – The axis type.

  • axis_name (str, default=None) – The name of the axis.

  • data (list, default=None) – The data of the axis.

  • fontsize (int, default=None) – The font size of the axis name.

  • lim (tuple, list, default=None) – The limitation range of the axis.

  • boundary_gap (bool, default=None) – The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis.

  • name_gap (Union[str, int], default=None) – Gap between axis name and axis line.

  • name_location (str, default=None) – Location of the axis name.

  • axis_label_interval (int, default=None) – Interval between each text label.

  • axis_label_width (int, default=None) – Width of text block, by default None.

  • axis_label_overflow (str, default='none') – How to handle labels out of width.

  • axis_label_rotate (int, default=None) – The rotation degree of the axis label.

  • split_number (int, default=None) – Number of segments on the axis.

  • split_area_show (bool, default=False) – Whether to show the split area.

  • split_line_show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the split line.

  • axis_tick_align (str, default='none') – Align axis tick with label.

  • axis_list (list, default=None) – The axis list input for multiple axes.

  • ignored (bool, default=False) – Whether the axis is ignored when combining axes.

set_yaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = None, lim: list | tuple = None, boundary_gap: bool = None, inverse: bool = None, name_location: str = None, name_gap: str | int = None, axis_label_width: int = None, axis_label_overflow='none', axis_label_interval: int = None, split_number: int = None, split_area_show: bool = False, split_line_show: bool = True, axis_tick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set y-axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the axis.

  • axis_type (str, default=None) – The axis type.

  • axis_name (str, default=None) – The name of the axis.

  • data (list, default=None) – The data of the axis.

  • fontsize (int, default=None) – The font size of the axis name.

  • lim (Union[list, tuple], default=None) – The limitation range of the axis.

  • boundary_gap (bool, default=None) – The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis.

  • inverse (bool, default=None) – Whether to invert the y-axis.

  • name_location (str, default=None) – Location of the axis name.

  • name_gap (Union[str, int], default=None) – Gap between axis name and axis line.

  • axis_label_width (int, default=None) – Width of text block.

  • axis_label_overflow (str, default='none') – How to handle labels out of width.

  • axis_label_interval (int, Optional) – Interval between each text label.

  • split_number (int, default=None) – Number of segments on the axis.

  • split_area_show (bool, default=False) – Whether to show the split area.

  • split_line_show (bool, default=True) – Whether to show the split line.

  • axis_tick_align (str, default='none') – Align axis tick with label.

  • axis_list (list, default=None) – The axis list input for multiple axes.

  • ignored (bool, default=False) – Whether the axis is ignored when combining axes.

show(options: dict = None, return_html: bool = False, silent: bool = False)#

Show the plot

Parameters:

  • options (dict, default=None) – The options to show. If None, options will be got from self.render().

  • return_html (bool, default=False) – Whether to return an HTML string.

  • silent (bool, default=False) – Whether to mute plot automatically.
